intro: Leandra lasiostachya, commonly known as the velvetleaf leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and are often adorned with a velvety texture. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in a dense, soft pubescence. Leandra lasiostachya thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
